title: "3 km Track Assembly"

---

> **TL;DR**
>
> - **Purpose:** Final assembly of Mass Driver from ready-made components
> - **Length:** 3 km (2-3 km depending on parameters)
> - **Time:** 3-6 months for first MD, 1-2 months for subsequent ones
> - **Robots:** Peak 50 robots (Moles, Centaurs, Crabs)

---

## Overview

Track assembly is the final stage of Mass Driver production, when ready-made components (rails, coils, frame) are installed into a single 3 km structure.

---

## Assembly Stages

### Complete Sequence

| Stage | Time | Robots | Work |
|-------|------|--------|------|
| 1. Site preparation | 2 weeks | 20 Centaur-M | Leveling, marking |
| 2. Trench excavation (3 km) | **3 months** | 50 Mole-M | Regolith excavation |
| 3. Concrete support installation | 2 weeks | 20 Centaur-M | 300 supports every 10 m |
| 4. Frame installation | 1 month | 30 Centaur-M | 250 truss sections |
| 5. Rail laying | 2 weeks | 20 Centaur-M | 300 segments of 10 m |
| 6. Coil mounting | 1 month | 10 Centaur-M | 3000 coils |
| 7. Power cable routing | 2 weeks | 15 Centaur-M | Coil power supply |
| 8. Cooling connection | 1 week | 10 Centaur-M | NaK circuit |
| 9. Electronics installation | 2 weeks | 15 Centaur-M | Sensors, controllers |
| 10. Calibration and testing | 1 week | 5 Centaur-M | Geometry, tests |
| **TOTAL** | **~6 months** | peak 50 | |

**With experience (subsequent MDs):** ~**2-3 months**

---

## Stage Details

### 1. Site Preparation

| Work | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Route selection | Along the terminator (day/night boundary) |
| Geodetic marking | Laser leveling, accuracy +/-5 mm |
| Leveling | Moles cut regolith bumps |
| Base preparation | Temporary structure installation |

**Route requirements:**
- Straight line (deviation <1 mm per 100 m)
- Slope <0.1% (0.38g gravity is not critical)
- Distance from craters >500 m (safety)

---

### 2. Trench Excavation

**The longest stage** - 50 Mole-M robots dig a 3 km trench.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Trench width | 6 m |
| Depth | 3 m |
| Excavation volume | 54,000 m³ regolith |
| Mole productivity | 100 t/day = ~35 m³/day |
| Time for 1 Mole | ~1,540 days |
| Time for 50 Moles | **~31 days = 1 month** |

**Correction:** Accounting for charging breaks and shifts - **3 months**.

**More details:** [Mole-M Robots](../../robots/assembly/moles.qmd)

---

### 3. Concrete Support Installation

300 concrete supports every 10 m to support the frame.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Supports | 300 |
| Support mass | 1 t concrete |
| Foundation depth | 2-3 m |
| Time per support | 1 hour |
| **TOTAL** | **300 hours = 2 weeks (20 robots)** |

---

### 4. Frame Installation

Truss sections are installed on supports and welded.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Frame sections | 250 (12 m each) |
| Section mass | ~3 t |
| Installation time per section | 2 hours (lifting + welding) |
| **TOTAL** | **500 hours = 1 month (30 robots)** |

**More details:** [Tunnel Frame](../elements/frame.qmd)

---

### 5. Rail Laying

Aluminum rails are mounted on the frame.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Rail segments | 300 (10 m each, 2 rails) |
| Segment mass | ~0.7 t |
| Laying time per segment | 1 hour |
| Joint welding | 10 min per joint |
| **TOTAL** | **400 hours = 2 weeks (20 robots)** |

**More details:** [Rail Production](../elements/rails.qmd)

---

### 6. Coil Mounting

3000 coils are installed along the track.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Coils | 3000 |
| Installation time per coil | 15 min |
| **TOTAL** | **750 hours = 1 month (10 robots)** |

**More details:** [Coil Winding](../elements/coils.qmd)

---

### 7. Power Cable Routing

Power supply for coils from the energy system.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Cable length | ~10 km (main line + branches) |
| Cross-section | 100-200 mm² Al |
| Cable mass | ~30 t |
| Routing time | **2 weeks (15 robots)** |

---

### 8. Cooling Connection

NaK circuit for cryogenic cooling.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| NaK tube length | ~6 km |
| Diameter | 20 mm |
| Radiators | 5000 m² (facing shadow) |
| Connection time | **1 week (10 robots)** |

---

### 9. Electronics Installation

Sensors, controllers, control systems.

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Control units | 100 (every 30 m) |
| Sensors | 600 (current, temperature, position) |
| Cameras | 50 (track monitoring) |
| Installation time | **2 weeks (15 robots)** |

**More details:** [Control Electronics](electronics.qmd)

---

### 10. Calibration and Testing

Final check before launch.

| Test | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Track geometry | Laser leveling, accuracy +/-0.5 mm |
| Electrical circuits | Ohmmeter, insulation, inductance |
| Cooling | NaK circuit test, temperature -150C |
| Test shot (dry run) | Empty container acceleration |

**Time:** 1 week

**More details:** [Testing](testing.qmd)

---

## Material Balance

**Per 1 MD (3 km):**

| Component | Mass | Source |
|-----------|------|--------|
| Frame (steel) | 800 t | [Regolith Processing](../../materials/overview.qmd) |
| Rails (aluminum) | 210 t | [Regolith Processing](../../materials/overview.qmd) |
| Coils (aluminum) | 300 t | [Regolith Processing](../../materials/overview.qmd) |
| Electronics | 7 t | **"Vitamins" from Earth** |
| Concrete (supports) | 300 t | Local (regolith + sulfur) |
| **TOTAL** | **~1600 t** | **99.5% local** |

| Transport | Robots | Role |
